content: The camera bump is just a couple fractions of a mm bigger this year, from my review.
The Internet may not need another iPhone X review but it absolutely does need the @JoannaStern iPhone X user manual.
Here's my full iPhone X review, not first impressions, extended use.
Too Many Sacrifices: Complaints about fat bezels and missing features like the ultrawide camera.
A closer look at the iPhone X display's OLED diamond subpixel pattern from @reneritchie's @iMore review.
It glitches often, crazy when the battery is 1%. The letters on the keyboard would disappear. The entire app just hangs.
iPhone X shipped 6 years ago, yet hasn't aged a day ✨ stunning design.
This review of the iPhone X tele lens only uses RAW/DNG files, no jpegs.
This #iPhoneX Face ID ain't got nothing on Arya.
iPhone X shipped 6 years ago, yet hasn't aged a day ✨ stunning design.
Latest iPhone X camera review showcases beautiful images of Guatemala.
The stunning design and beautiful OLED screen are definite pros. Face ID works well, and the cameras are great with fast performance.
I love the edge to edge display. The bright OLED display really pops, and the new Face ID is a huge advancement.
The iPhone X feels unique and new. I recommend you hold one. It is the best phone I have ever had.
I really want to buy an iPhone X, but the reviews about screen burn-in make me feel worried about the OLED display.
The iPhone X feels unique and new. I recommend you hold one. It is the best phone I have ever had.
What a waste of money, the iphone X is very expensive to buy and repair, I regret buying it.
Overall, I think it looks really nice and works very well. I will be recommending this phone to my friends and family.
I really want to buy an iPhone X, but the reviews about screen burn-in make me feel worried about the OLED display.
The iPhone X changes the core model of iPhone which was the same from iPhone 6 to iPhone 8 but I still think it lacks many features.
I think the price is unfair. OLED and FaceID are the differentiators in the iphone X but neither are groundbreaking innovations.
I have recently been upgraded to X from 6s. I have heard so many negative reviews about this one and literally no one bothered me.
Camera upgrades are not an incentive because my iPhone X which I bought 4 years ago still takes pictures and videos perfectly.
Significantly more battery life is achieved with the iphone X than previous models. It has solved many battery problems.
The pattern on the back looks randomized and unique, making it hard to fake, which is cool.
I wonder how Face ID would work if you lost a lot of weight, would it recognize you?
Wow, the Face ID is actually doing what Apple said it would. That is really cool.
I feel like I made the right choice getting the Pixel 2 XL after reading these reviews.
iOS 11 is a mess right now, hopefully things will change and it will be smoother soon.
Thank you! It's hard to find honest reviews now, yours really stands out from the rest.
Is there any reason to consider the Note 8 over the Pixel 2 XL? The XL2 seems refreshing.
I agree with everything in this article, especially how the new Pixel never slows down.
The iPhone X is like the most popular girl in school that everyone wants and lusts after.
This is offensive for people that are actually poor, way to go OP with the comment.
The reviewer said the iPhone X is his favorite iPhone yet, but it's not perfect.
I disagree about the learning curve, it only took 5 minutes to get used to the new home way.
True Tone is the most underrated feature, it adjusts colors for different lighting conditions so well.
The iPhone X is the global model. I am excited to get mine here in New Zealand.
I would take a hit in endurance and get the Intel modem to avoid Qualcomm's abusive monopoly.
Good attempt, but you're never going to get anyone to care about modem differences.
Can I expect the Qualcomm version or the Intel version when picking up my X from UK store?
I don't think Apple would skimp on their flagship product over a small cost difference.
Oh my God... Reachability is still here on the iPhone X! Friday can't come fast enough.
Face ID worked with the iPhone X laying on the counter you need to look at the phone.
The iPhone X's screen isn't OLED-y enough, the colors aren't as saturated as Note 8.
I'm stoked to see our app Halide featured in the Verge review it will release Thursday.
I can't seem to find an iPhone X review that has a quick summary with pros/cons and a score.
The reviews did not report on the iPhone X's battery life which is something that I want to know.
I did not like The Verge First Look, complaining about Face ID while holding the phone weirdly.
Why do all reviews cover every feature? Just show the phone and pictures from the phone.
The X has the same navigating gestures as the BlackBerry Z10, I loved using that.
I think the iPhone X and XS were some of the most unique designs ever done for an iPhone.
The iPhone X size was manageable and the rounded edges were comfortable and looked slimmer.
My mother loves her XS Max and it’s still doing great, battery still lasts her the day.
Great phone. 3D Touch was so good on the X. It’s still unbelievable that they removed it.
I still think the X was the best looking iPhone, the last true upgrade that felt amazing.
The edge-to-edge display was the game-changer for me, kept it for 4 years before upgrading.
The X was my favorite model apart from iPhone 4, it was just so good and beautiful.
I got a refurbished X in 2020 and I’m still using it, a great phone with no hate.
Such a beautiful sexy phone. I miss mine because the modern phones look too chunky now.
Great camera on the X. But after three years it was slow, had to trade it in to upgrade.
Loved my X as a secondary phone. Sad I can’t upgrade it to iOS 17, need an SE size.
I love iPhone X!
Not unpopular at all. Many people loved the x and every installment of iPhones.
YESSSS, I loved how light, thin it was. It fit perfectly in my hands, one thumb could reach.
I think that the iPhone X is the best iPhone ever in innovation and phone relation.
It was the first iPhone I bought at launch, I knew it was the future and was so excited.
It was literally the best selling smartphone in the entire world during its sales period.
I LOVED my X almost as much as the 4, both were revolutionary in their respective launches.
The X has aged the slowest, it still feels brand new and I don’t need to upgrade yet.
The X was the perfect revamp of the iPhone, it still keeps up with the big boys today.
I have the iPhone X and haven’t upgraded, might upgrade to the 2020 iPhone if it's good.
I got an X for 500$ it was a great choice - it feels just as powerful as the 11.
